name: silo

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: silex
variants.description: Builds Silex, a GUI for viewing Silo files

description:
Silo is a library for reading and writing a wide variety of scientific
data to binary, disk files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: autoconf-archive
dependencies.description:
The GNU Autoconf Archive is a collection of more than 500 macros for GNU
Autoconf.

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
MPItrampoline: A forwarding MPI implementation that can use any other
MPI implementation via an MPI ABI.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: qt
dependencies.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependencies.name: libx11
dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.

dependencies.name: libxmu
dependencies.description:
This library contains miscellaneous utilities and is not part of the
Xlib standard. It contains routines which only use public interfaces so
that it may be layered on top of any proprietary implementation of Xlib
or Xt.

dependencies.name: readline
dependencies.description:
The GNU Readline library provides a set of functions for use by
applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed
in. Both Emacs and vi editing modes are available. The Readline library
includes additional functions to maintain a list of previously-entered
command lines, to recall and perhaps reedit those lines, and perform
csh-like history expansion on previous commands.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependent_to.name: conduit
dependent_to.description:
Conduit is an open source project from Lawrence Livermore National
Laboratory that provides an intuitive model for describing hierarchical
scientific data in C++, C, Fortran, and Python. It is used for data
coupling between packages in-core, serialization, and I/O tasks.

dependent_to.name: parflow
dependent_to.description:
ParFlow is an open-source parallel watershed simulator which includes
overland flow, complex topology, heterogeneity and coupled land-surface
processes.

dependent_to.name: coevp
dependent_to.description:
CoEVP is a scale-bridging proxy application for embedded viscoplasticity
applications. It is created and maintained by The Exascale Co-Design
Center for Materials in Extreme Environments (ExMatEx). The code is
intended to serve as a vehicle for co-design by allowing others to
extend and/or reimplement it as needed to test performance of new
architectures, programming models, etc. Due to the size and complexity
of the studied models, as well as restrictions on distribution, the
currently available LULESH proxy application provides the coarse-scale
model implementation and the ASPA proxy application provides the
adaptive sampling support.

dependent_to.name: visit
dependent_to.description:
VisIt is an Open Source, interactive, scalable, visualization, animation
and analysis tool.

dependent_to.name: amp
dependent_to.description:
The Advanced Multi-Physics (AMP) package. The Advanced Multi-Physics
(AMP) package is an open source parallel object-oriented computational
framework that is designed with single and multi-domain multi-physics
applications in mind.

dependent_to.name: bookleaf-cpp
dependent_to.description: BookLeaf is a 2D unstructured hydrodynamics mini-app.

dependent_to.name: lulesh
dependent_to.description:
LULESH is a highly simplified application, hard-coded to only style
typical in scientific C or C++ based applications. Hard code to only
solve a Sedov blast problem with analytic answer

dependent_to.name: macsio
dependent_to.description: A Multi-purpose, Application-Centric, Scalable I/O Proxy Application.

dependent_to.name: cabana
dependent_to.description: The Exascale Co-Design Center for Particle Applications Toolkit

dependent_to.name: beatnik
dependent_to.description:
Fluid interface model solver based on Pandya and Shkoller's Z-Model
formulation.

dependent_to.name: paraview
dependent_to.description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and
visualization application. This package includes the Catalyst in-situ
library for versions 5.7 and greater, otherwise use the catalyst
package.

dependent_to.name: simulationio
dependent_to.description: SimulationIO: Efficient and convenient I/O for large PDE simulations

dependent_to.name: samrai
dependent_to.description:
SAMRAI (Structured Adaptive Mesh Refinement Application Infrastructure)
is an object-oriented C++ software library enables exploration of
numerical, algorithmic, parallel computing, and software issues
associated with applying structured adaptive mesh refinement (SAMR)
technology in large-scale parallel application development.

dependent_to.name: visit-silo
dependent_to.description:
This is the Silo Plug-In for VisIt. It can be installed after VisIt is
installed along SILO library. It is made as an extension to VisIt that
can be activated or as an environment with a view: ~/.visit Complete
explanation at:
https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/22907#issuecomment-824218296
